Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Game
extends javafx.application.Application
implements java.io.Serializable
    Author:
    SHUBHAM _THAKRAL, TANMAY BANSAL This class is the game class. It extends the Application class and implements the Serializable interface. It creates the javafx stage for the actual game and initializes the first start screen. It is also used to add the power ups, coins, blocks etc on the pane. It overrides the start method of the Application class and implements the serialize and deserialize methods to save and restore the state of a game.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • serialize

        public void serialize()
               throws java.io.IOException
        This function is used to serialize the ongoing game, if it is closed abruptly.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown

      • deserialize

        public static Game deserialize()
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        This function is used to restore the last state of the game, when the player closed it while playing.
        Returns:
        It returns the object of Game class, which contains the state of the last state of the game, when the player close the game abruptly.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - It is thrown if the file resume.txt does not exist, or there is some error in reading the objects of the class.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - It is thrown if the JVM can't find the Game.class file.

      • start

        public void start(javafx.stage.Stage theStage)
        This function overrides the start method the Application class. It is used to spawn a new thread which will display the stage of the game.
        Specified by:
        start in class javafx.application.Application

      • makeBallPowerUp

        public Sprite makeBallPowerUp(double px,
                              double py,
                              int value)
        This method is used to display a ball power up on canvas at a particular location.
        Parameters:
        px - is used to store the x-coordinate of the position where the power up has to be displayed.
        py - is used to store the y-coordinate of the position where the power up has to be displayed.
        value - stores the value by which the length of the snake increases if the snake will eat it.
        Returns:
        It returns the ball object of actual type BallPowerUp and declared type Sprite class.
